intro: Jacea splendens, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Jacea splendens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
